TEXT: e1: Yes, it's annoying and cumbersome to separate your rubbish properly all the time.
e2: Three different bin bags stink away in the kitchen and have to be sorted into different wheelie bins.
CN RELATION: bin bags, stink (HasProperty)/bin bags, kitchen (LocatedAt)/bin bags, sorted into wheelie bins (ReceivesAction)

TEXT: e3: But still Germany produces way too much rubbish
e4: and too many resources are lost when what actually should be separated and recycled is burnt.
CN RELATION: resources, get lost (ReceivesAction)/resources, seperated (ReceivesAction)/resources, recycled (ReceivesAction)/resources, burnt (ReceivesAction)

TEXT: e5: We Berliners should take the chance and become pioneers in waste separation!

MISSING INFORMATION 1: Waste separation means separating your rubbish.
CN RELATIONS 1: waste separation, separating rubbish (IsA)/waste separation, separating rubbish (DefinedAs)

MISSING INFORMATION 1: Rubbish is separated into different wheelie bins.
It is bad for the environment to produce too much rubbish.
MISSING INFORMATION 2: Waste separation is part of environmental protection.

MISSING INFORMATION 1: If too much rubbish is produced, it is important to sort it.

MISSING INFORMATION 2: If too much rubbish is produced, it is important to separate and recycle it.
